Title: Don and Donny
Credits: Story created by Kevin Gallegos, Base created by Adam Smith (amsmith@ucsc.edu).

Home.Body:
This is home, you have been here for as long as you remember.
Do you remember when the birds sang the playful melody?
Do you remember when your imitations were accompanied by his?
Those from the birds may have been more eloquent, but our ensemble was priceless.
Those are the melodies you cant forget.

Room.Body: This is your room, its cozy and nice. Although I gotta start heading to school, I might be late again.

Kitchen.Body:
This is where you and Donnie would always eat, mom makes some great food. I quickly grab my breakfast and book it to the door.
I think I dropped my appleslices but thats ok, I'll just ask Don for his!

FrontDoor.Body:
A gentle yet freezing breeze slips through the fram of the front door.
It brings a slight chill to your skin, yet it feels inviting
As if behind this door awaits reality you ever so long for.

Curb.Body:
I have so many memories playing on the curb with him
Sometimes I wonder if he would buy me a new ball since he
since he
lost it.

Sidewalk.Body:
The walks to school and back always seem so fun.
Don would always tell me the silliest stories in his imagination, sometimes he drifts away
Going on and on about his imaginary friends.

EndBlock.Body:
I guess Iam at the park curb, its always so much fun here! Maybe we could spare some time at the playground
Unless Donny thinks we will be late for class.

Choices.Text: Keep moving on, Your gonna be late!

playground.Body: Don and I's favorite were the swings, riding them and chatting until the sun slid under the mountains

keys.message:
A newspaper clipping of an incident involving a kid perishing from getting struck by an automobile
The car was reported as 2010 Honda Civic
The driver was never found

Field.Body:
Grass, don't forget to check for ticks! We gotta keep marching on!
I'm pretty sure Don is allergic to grass.
Or was it the bugs biting him?
I don't seem to remember anymore.

Swings.Body:
As You slowly gain height, the breeze of the gentle afternoon fills your nostrils, A deja vu of sorts
you ask him if the both of you could reach the stars
You can see over some trees, and the breeze has become a wind
You can't help but feel at ease

Bench.Body:
The Bench where Donny and I would sit, we would always start complaining about school
Its the conversations on these benches that were always so memorable.
Donnie told me once about a kid who drank spoiled milk for 5 bucks during lunch
He- would've done it for like 20 if I- was, was being honest.

Schoolyard.Body: We go to the same school, Don and I, I would get in trouble for talking but not Don somehow, He would always seem to go unnoticed

Classroom.Body:
I wonder if Donnie hates math like I do.
If theres any subject he loves its history!
He loves the idea about how the past can mold the future, he always goes on and on about it.
What was that ringing?
Oh right, I gotta head to the office right now.

Office.Body:
Its time to take medication, yet I can never find Donnie after I take my medicine
Hopefully tomorrow we can walk to school once more.

Computer.Body:
I make a break for it
I cant lose him again, its too painful
I run into the Office and lock my self in.
A computer screen flickers in the dark office
Do I read the message?

Email.Body:
Dear Parents:
In light of recent unfortunate and grave matters, the school will be hosting a ceremony to honor Don Westla,
a student who unfortunatly past away in car accident earlier in the year
Please wear proper attire and report to the stadium for the ceremony
-Principle Williams

end.Body:
You feel dizzy, something doesn't feel right, you look around and see Don slowly fade as if he was never there
If he even was, that is.
